Package view_control

Class ModifyCustomerWindowController

java.lang.Object
view_control.ModifyCustomerWindowController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyCustomerWindowController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Version:
1.0 Contains methods for editing a selected customer and writing the changes to the database.
Author:
Brayden McArthur

    void cancelButtonClicked()
    Sets the scene back to the Customer window, which also reloads the table view with the data from the database

    When a country is selected from the country ComboBox, the division ComboBox is set to a list of all divisions that are associated with the chosen country in the database.

    • populateFields

      public void populateFields​(Customer customer) throws java.lang.Exception
      Populates the TextFields/ComboBoxes with data obtained from the selected Customer in the table from the previous scene.
      Parameters:
      customer - is the selected Customer from the customerTable in the CustomerWindowController.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in Fetcher.

    • countryComboBoxOnAction

      public void countryComboBoxOnAction()
      When a country is selected from the country ComboBox, the division ComboBox is set to a list of all divisions that are associated with the chosen country in the database. Uses a Try/Catch block in case there is an error in Fethcer.

    • setFullNameText

      public void setFullNameText​(java.lang.String fullNameText)

      Parameters:

      public void setDivision​(java.lang.String division, java.lang.String country) throws java.lang.Exception

      Parameters:

    • validateInput

      public boolean validateInput()
      Validates the input entered by the user. All fields must not be empty and non String type fields must only contain whole numbers. If invalid data is entered the alertBox method is called and displays the error message in an alert window.
      Returns:
      Returns True if all if statements are false.

    • okButtonClicked

      public void okButtonClicked() throws java.lang.Exception
      If valid input has been entered, a customer object is created from the provided input and written to the database
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Throws Exception if there is an error in Fetcher or in cancelButtonClicked().

    • cancelButtonClicked

      public void cancelButtonClicked() throws java.io.IOException
      Sets the scene back to the Customer window, which also reloads the table view with the data from the database
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws IOException if there is an error loading the FXML file.
